In my last post, I gave you the code to pull the raw trading data of any wallet on

Today, we are going to learn how to read the output of the
. We are going to dissect a real log (from the script I shared) to show you how to spot:
If you are copying trades without checking these metrics, you are flying blind. Here is how to open your eyes.
1. The "Time Profitable" Metric: The Truth Serum
Most traders only care about the final result:
"How much pain did they endure to get there?"
Look at this section from the tool's output:
for 66% of the trade. They spent twice as much time losing as they did winning.
If you copy-traded this wallet, you would have been staring at red numbers for most of the hour. You need "diamond hands" to follow them.
. These are the "Snipers." Their entry timing is so perfect that they go green immediately and stay green.
is who you want to copy.
2. The Hedge Check: Finding Free Money
This is the most critical metric in the entire script. It tells you if the trader is gambling or printing cash.
In a binary market, YES + NO always settles at $1.00.
, they are neutral. They have zero edge.
. It doesn't matter who wins; they paid 95 cents for a dollar bill.
Run this script on the top 10 holders of a market. If you find someone with a Combined
they bought. You just found an arbitrage opportunity.
How do you know if you are competing against a person or an algorithm? The tool tells you instantly.

human can click that fast. This is a bot.
Do not try to "race" this trader. They will front-run you. If you see this pattern, you need to beat them on
Did they panic buy? Or did they slowly build a position like a pro?
They started small (testing the water) and bet bigger as they got confident. This is a sign of a disciplined trader.
This is a warning sign. It means they were
(Fear Of Missing Out). They kept buying even as the price got worse.
